page.title: 01HILLS SOUTH OF BARDON MILL
page.content: This area os predominately farmland, some arable near the River South Tyne, but mostly fell country used for sheep rearing. Some milk production. The area also includes most of the National Trust Allen Banks, deciduous woodland area along River Allen, well used by public. Willimoteswyke is a 14th century border castle, now a farm. Bettingham, only a hamlet with half a dozen houses, has been a place of worship for more tham 1000 years. Apart from Allen Banks are Ridley Hall. The area is very remote and undisturbed. Ridley Hall, a 19th century mansion, is now used as a loarding wing for a local state High School. A playgroup and adult lectures are held here as it is the nearest school centre for Bardon Mill.
